definition: to run away secretly with the intention of getting married usually without parental consent
examples: … Waterman was a peevish child who grew into a defiant teenager, eloped at 18 largely to shock his father, and then—far too young—was a father himself.

definition: to run away from one's spouse with a lover
examples: " … when they had been married nearly seven years, and were within a few weeks of the time when the brother's death would have adjusted all, she eloped with a younger man, and left him."
… might have mistaken him for … some scarecrow eloped from a cornfield.

definition: to leave a health-care or educational facility without permission or authorization
examples: …10 suicidal patients deemed 'high risk for suicide' eloped from the Emergency Department from October 2014 and February 2015.
Police in Ohio said this week that they gave a nursing home resident a ride and dropped him off at a gas station without ever knowing he was a dementia patient who had eloped.
